item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1719 had a crack and released approximately one (1) gallon to the dock floor. R+L Carriers remediated the dock floor, then retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to perform a tote transfer. The crew transferred the tote and broke down the damaged tote for containerization in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2025041814

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE WORLDPORT LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY FACILITY EIGHT AIR PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH AND WERE PRINTED PERISHABLE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MEAT IN EACH BOX. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE ARE 1Z50RW850194515072, 1Z50RW850191732495, 1Z50RW850194655251, 1Z50RW850190194444, 1Z50RW850192831028, 1Z50RW850192746086 AND 1Z50RW850192625037. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM IOWA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 50RW85, PINE RIDGE FARMS, 1800 MAURY ST, DES MOINES IA 50317.

  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 20:40 PM ET, Alyssa Estes with NMO contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Montgomery, AL. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Sure Klean 600, which released from 1-1-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift puncture during dock operations. The spill has impacted the dock floor only. The call center will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup as this is a corrosive release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3264 Sure Klean 600 product released to dock floor due to forklift puncture. The contractors used absorbents to dry up the spill and sprayed with soda ash solution to neutralize it. The impacted pallet was wrapped and was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails in a paper box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the pails and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040643
item.description:
Report E-2025040643

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: DONALSONVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 04/16/2025, at 19:19 hours, CSX personnel, reported train M64515 transporting car FURX 894276 (Load, Crude Zinc Oxide) was leaking a white material from a hole in the bottom of the hopper car. The reported location was mile post AN 753.00 on the Dothan subdivision, near the Fox Lane crossing, in Donalsonville, GA. The initial cause of the release was damage to the hopper body which has resulted from mechanical failure of the car's truck assembly. Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSX emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the incident. Upon arrival, contractor personnel confirmed two wheel burns to the hopper body which resulted in product spillage. Contractor personnel patched the holes, and the car was held pending unloading or movement under OTMA.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. The paint dried so Dayton Freight personnel did not need to deploy granular absorbents to the impacted area. They gathered the damaged pail and containerized it into one (1) 8-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025041745
item.description:
Report X-2025041745

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Supervisor states that checker Emzer Caston was loading trailer 504741 when his rear tire slipped on a dock bumper and pushed him forward into a shipment of UN3082, ENVIRONMENTALLY HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, N.O.S. (POLYAMINE RESIN), 9, PG III, MARINE POLLUTANT which completely punctured the 5 5 gallon drum and is actively spilling from the trailer onto the yard. ABF Supervisor states that about 20 gallons or so has spilled into the yard and that rain is in the forecast around 11PM (EST) tonight for Atlanta. Safety advised to block off the premise of the spill and try their best to stop t he spill from entering any drains. ABF Supervisor states that deployed snakes to stop the spill from spreading on the yard. Safety contacted CURA and they're dispatching a cleanup crew on emergency response to the terminal. FCE personnel collected two (2) damaged 55-gallon drums and placed in two (2 ) overpacks for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor and concrete yard beneath the trailer and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, FCE personnel utilized a cleaning agent and absorbent pads to collect any residual product from the impacted s urfaces. All UN3082 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2)55-gallon drums and ABF personnel took possession of the waste for terminal disposal. FCE personnel noted no further actions required on-site and crews demobilized.

A spill response contractor was called to the location of the trailer, since the driver did not have the equipment needed to remove the leaking drum from the trailer. The spill contractor found the leaking drum, removed it from the trailer, placed the leaking drum into an overpack, and then cleaned up the material on the inside and outside of the trailer. The overpack was placed back in the trailer. A minimal amount of material, less than 1 gallon, was released below the trailer. The rest of the material was contained to the inside of the trailer. Upon observation of the drum, it looks like there was a very small puncture in the side of the drum.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2025, Hub personnel reported that unit RNLU 100108 was leaking a blue liquid that had seeped through the container floor, resulting in a spill of less than 1 gallon of product onto the ground. An interior inspection of the cargo inside revealed a mixed load of hazardous materials palletized and (Printer Ink) in 55 gallon drum on the floor of the container towards the rear of the container. The pallets were stowed two rows wide, stacked two high. The load was secured using a 4x4 foot piece of lumber nailed into a 40"x48" pallet at the rear of the container. A 55 gallon drum containing printer ink, classified as a Class 3 Flammable Hazardous Material, was discovered leaking inside a container positioned on railcar FEC 72198. Upon inspection, it was determined that approximately 25 gallons of ink had been released inside the container and onto the interior of the railcar. Further examination of the drum revealed two cracks at the bottom, which were identified as the source of the leak.

  • Description: Driver overfilled in ground diesel fuel tank at Kum and Go gas station while making a fuel delivery. Underground tank had the flapper device shut due to the tank volume reaching the overfill protection. Driver unhooked the hose full of diesel fuel spilling the contents on the ground around the tank. Roughly 4 gallons impacted concrete only and the Solar Driver was able to use his spill kit to clean up the effected area no further clean up was required. Iowa DNR was called but Dispatch was told it didn't meet the trigger Qty for a report.

item.title: Report E-2025040455
item.description:
Report E-2025040455

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: CHASKA
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS SPECIALTY PRODUCTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Our driver hooked up his hose to begin the offloading of anhydrous ammonia into a refrigeration system. Once the hose was hooked up, the driver started pumping the liquid ammonia. After starting the pump, the driver noticed a small leak at the hose connection. The driver then attempted to fix the leak with out shutting the pump off and putting on his PPE. While tightening the connection he moved the nozzle on the hose causing an aerosol of ammonia that traveled past his face which caused eye irritation due to not having goggles on. The duration of the leak was less than one minute and the release was fixed by getting the hose nozzle tightened at the connection.

  • City: SAN JOSE

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver pulled a tanker out of the SJ facility while the dome lid was still partially open. This caused some of the tanker contents to spill out in the SJ Facility yard and onto the street (Berryessa Rd). SJ Technician loaded the tanker but didn't close the lid before the driver proceeded to leave the facility. SJ Technician saw liquid spilling from the tanker when the driver was still heading onto the public roadway. Another employee pulled next to the truck to advise of the leak. immediately discovered the dome lid was not closed. Dome lid was properly closed and secured. Team proceeded to report the spill and start the cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2025041705
item.description:
Report X-2025041705

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: Portland - Clackamas
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 6th, 2024 the PTRC reported to BNSF SID that the CBTX 742660 was found by ODOT Hazmat inspector to be leaking vapor through the vacuum relief valve (VRV). BNSF mobilized contractors to the car to inspect. Upon inspection it was found that vapors were releasing through the VRV. Contractors removed the leaking VRV and applied a 2.5" plug in its place and confirmed the car was no longer leaking. The shipper applied for and received an OTMA so the car could continue to destination. Only vapors were observed to have released and no cleanup was necessary as vapors dissipated. Volumes reported are based upon responders observations and are estimates only.
